docs.lead_paragraph: An Alabama doctor-turned-lawmaker said on Tuesday he was abandoning his push to overturn a law requiring insurers to pay for post-pregnancy hospital stays that was inspired by and named after a former patient of his who died days after giving birth.

headline.main: Alabama Lawmaker Drops Bid to Repeal Law Named for His Dead Patient
headline.print_headline: Alabama Lawmaker Drops Bid to Repeal Law Named for His Dead Patient

docs.snippet: An Alabama doctor-turned-lawmaker said on Tuesday he was abandoning his push to overturn a law requiring insurers to pay for post-pregnancy hospital stays that was inspired by and named after a former patient of his who died days after giving birth.

docs.lead_paragraph: Indonesian prosecutors on Tuesday sought jail sentences of 18 years for an American man and 15 years for his girlfriend if they are found guilty of murdering the woman's mother while vacationing on the resort island of Bali last year.

headline.main: Indonesian Prosecutors Seek Up to 18-Year Term for US Couple
headline.print_headline: Indonesian Prosecutors Seek Up to 18-Year Term for US Couple

docs.snippet: Indonesian prosecutors on Tuesday sought jail sentences of 18 years for an American man and 15 years for his girlfriend if they are found guilty of murdering the woman's mother while vacationing on the resort island of Bali last year.

docs.lead_paragraph: An Alabama doctor-turned-lawmaker is seeking to overturn a state law named for one of his patients, whose death 16 years earlier triggered legislation requiring insurers to pay for minimum post-pregnancy hospital stays, records show.

headline.main: Alabama Lawmaker Pushes Repeal of Law Named After His Dead Patient
headline.print_headline: Alabama Lawmaker Pushes Repeal of Law Named After His Dead Patient

docs.snippet: An Alabama doctor-turned-lawmaker is seeking to overturn a state law named for one of his patients, whose death 16 years earlier triggered legislation requiring insurers to pay for minimum post-pregnancy hospital stays, records show.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie is backing federal legislation that would ban abortions at 20 weeks of pregnancy.

headline.main: Christie Backs Proposed Stricter Abortion Regulations
headline.print_headline: Christie Backs Proposed Stricter Abortion Regulations

docs.snippet: Republican New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie is backing federal legislation that would ban abortions at 20 weeks of pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Every year, slightly more boy babies than girl babies are born worldwide. But back when sperm meets egg, the two sexes are conceived in equal numbers, a new study suggests.

headline.main: Study Finds Equality Between Sexes at Moment of Conception
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Equality Between Sexes at Moment of Conception

docs.snippet: Every year, slightly more boy babies than girl babies are born worldwide. But back when sperm meets egg, the two sexes are conceived in equal numbers, a new study suggests.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Colorado woman whose fetus was cut out of her womb in a knife attack by a stranger called her unborn child "a light being" and thanked all her well-wishers for their support.

headline.main: Colorado Fetus Attack Victim Says Unborn Child Is 'Light Being'
headline.print_headline: Colorado Fetus Attack Victim Says Unborn Child Is 'Light Being'

docs.snippet: A Colorado woman whose fetus was cut out of her womb in a knife attack by a stranger called her unborn child "a light being" and thanked all her well-wishers for their support.

docs.lead_paragraph: Extremely overweight women, and their babies, face complications.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by obstetrician and gynecologist Claire A Putnam details the many dangers and complications that are more likely to crop up in pregnant women who are obese, both for mother's health and for the child's; underscores importance of doctors discussing with their pregnant patients the dangers of obesity.
docs.snippet: Extremely overweight women, and their babies, face complications.

docs.lead_paragraph: Also, questions about sharing a name with a pet, an inconsiderate suitemate and whether to say thank you for a thank-you gift.

headline.main: Advice on Spreading Good News Carefully

docs.abstract: Philip Galanes Social Q's column on how to be sensitive to women having trouble conceiving, dog's names, college roommates and thank-you notes.
docs.snippet: Also, questions about sharing a name with a pet, an inconsiderate suitemate and whether to say thank you for a thank-you gift.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new approach uses openness and humor to make “The Talk” less dreadful for parents and children alike.
docs.abstract: Bonnie Rochman article describes scene at For Girls Only, two-part course taught by nurse Julie Metzger, who has sought for decades to make sexual education talks between parents and their children less awkward, more engaging and even fun.
docs.snippet: A new approach uses openness and humor to make “The Talk” less dreadful for parents and children alike.

byline.contributor: Bonnie Rochman is a health writer and is working on a book about how genetics is reshaping childhood.
